result.execSummary:
The defendant George A Diver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George A Diver

defendant.name: Diver, George A
defendant.address: Wilson House Group Home 2409 Rudolph Rd, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Cases 22CM430, 22CM501 are called at 9:54 AM) Defendant George A Diver in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CM501 Count 1- Resisting an Officer and 22CM430 Count 1- Disorderly Conduct. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders the Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs.

9:50 AM Cases called: 22CM430 & 22CM501. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant George A Diver in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for George A Diver. Attorney Rivard does not have an offer from the State.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:51 AM Cases called: 22CM430 & 22CM501. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant George A Diver in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for George A Diver. 

22CM501 - Waives reading of the complaint and bond is set. 

All cases: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/25/22 at 1:30pm
Status hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with D.A. or the Wilson Group Home located at 2509 Rudolph Road, EC. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.

(Case called at 11:51 AM- by Zoom) Defendant George Diver appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaint. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/20/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 07/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with D.A. or the Wilson Group Home located at 2509 Rudolph Road, EC.
